The given Node.js code is a TypeScript compiled JavaScript module that re-exports all exports from the "loggerMiddleware" module. It uses the `tslib` library to handle the re-export operation with `__exportStar`. Additionally, it includes a source map comment at the end, which allows browsers or other tools to map the compiled JavaScript code back to the original TypeScript source for debugging purposes.

Here is a simplified version of this functionality without the use of `tslib`:

```javascript
"use strict";
Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });
var loggerMiddleware = require("./loggerMiddleware");
Object.keys(loggerMiddleware).forEach(function(key) {
  if (key === "default" || key === "__esModule") return;
  Object.defineProperty(exports, key, {
    enumerable: true,
    get: function() {
      return loggerMiddleware[key];
    }
  });
});
```

This rewritten code manually re-exports each export from the `loggerMiddleware` module, while ignoring the default export and the `__esModule` property.
